block.p: Julia Kathleen Fuller, the daughter of Kathleen Fuller and Dr. Richard Fuller of Potomac, Md., was married yesterday to Yasuyuki Nakayama, a son of Hiroko and Shigeki Nakayama of Sagamihara, Japan. The Rev. Alida de Coster, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at Dumbarton House, a history museum in Washington.
The couple, both 33, received M.B.A. degrees from the University of Virginia.

Julia Kathleen Fuller, the daughter of Kathleen Fuller and Dr. Richard Fuller of Potomac, Md., was married yesterday to Yasuyuki Nakayama, a son of Hiroko and Shigeki Nakayama of Sagamihara, Japan. The Rev. Alida de Coster, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at Dumbarton House, a history museum in Washington.
The couple, both 33, received M.B.A. degrees from the University of Virginia.

The bride will continue to use her name professionally. She is an associate in New York with the strategy group of MarchFirst, an Internet consulting firm. She graduated summa cum laude from Yale University. Her father is the director of clinical and prevention research at the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism in Bethesda, Md. Her mother is a technical librarian at the United States Patent and Trademark Office in Arlington, Va.

The bridegroom is a senior consultant on automobile manufacturing at Deloitte Consulting, in New York. He graduated from Hosei University in Tokyo. His mother retired as an administrative assistant from Kawaguchi Hospital in Sagamihara. His father is the deputy director of the Kanagawa Prefecture Social Welfare Corporation, a nonprofit organization that serves the mentally retarded in Sagamihara.
